data.question: Tricking people into giving up their passwords and information.
If you are in a gaming room and someone that you do not know asks you about personal information (same age as you-or close), what do you do?

options.desc: tell them just a little bit about yourself.
never give out any personal information.
tell them everything they want to know.
Don't trust what people say on the internet. They could be something different than they say

data.question: Which of the following best describes confidentiality as it relates to information protection?

options.desc: Keeping a spare password for information access
Preventing unauthorized users from accessing information

data.question: I'm online and I get a message from my Internet service provider asking for my password. They say they need it to fix my account. Should I give it to them?

options.desc: No. you should never give out your Internet password to anyone (even your best friends) other than your parents. Most other Internet service providers will never ask you for a password
